data.title: Dr. Edouard Boniface
data.text:
Four Seasons Tenure

Since 2023

First Four Seasons Assignment: Current

Employment History

Dispensaire de Hihifo, Wallis and Futuna; Urgences du CHU de Pointe a Pitre, Guadeloupe; Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Martinique, Martinique; Centre Médico-Social à Nouméa, New Caledonia; La Clinique de l'Ill USLD, Schiltigheim, France; Centre Hospitalier de la Basse-Terre, Guadeloupe; Private Practice; Clinique Les Tamarins, Reunion Island; Clinique Saint-Louis, Saint-Louis, France; Clinique du Ried (67), Schiltigheim, France; Hopital de Lagny sur Marne, Lagny sur Marne, France; Hopital de Pontoise, Pontoise, France; Hopital de Meulan, Les Mureaux, France; Hopital Jean Verdier, Bondy, France; Hopital Avicenne, Bobigny, France, Hopital André Grégoire, Montreuil, France; Hopital Le Raincy, Montfermeil, France

Education

Degree in Sports Medicine, University of Strasbourg; Degree in Manual and Osteopathic Medicine, Universite Paris 13; Degree in Antibiotic Therapy and Anti-Infective Treatments, University of Strasbourg

Birthplace

Paris, France

Languages Spoken

English, French

“I am here to assist guests as needed, helping them stay healthy, so they can best enjoy their stay with us,” says Dr. Edouard Boniface, Resort Doctor at Four Seasons Resort Bora Bora. “Their focus should be on soaking up the beauty and culture of this beautiful destination.”

A native of Paris, France, Edouard was inspired to help people and make a difference. At the behest of his father, who encouraged him to pursue a career in medicine, he set off to fulfill his childhood dream.

During his formal medical education in France, he earned degrees in Antibiotic Therapy and Anti-Infective Treatments, Manual and Osteopathic Medicine, and Sports Medicine, while also serving on the faculty at University of Strasbourg. Dr. Boniface then travelled the world practicing medicine and gaining valuable experience throughout France, Reunion Island, Guadeloupe, New Caledonia, Martinique, and Wallis and Futuna.

An osteopath, Dr. Boniface joined Four Seasons Resort Bora Bora in 2023 as Resort Doctor. He speaks English and French, and enjoys kitesurfing, surfing, fishing, and fitness classes.
